title: Why We Play Support
body:
Hey Guys, 

I've been reading a lot of support mains complaining about their role on the team.  Some is the problem of players (no credit for making good plays) while others are definitely more of a gameplay issue (itemization, lack of XP).  I thought it would be beneficial for the support mains to unite and start a discussion of why they like playing support, problems they see with the role and possible solutions.  Maybe, if we give enough quality feedback it could catalyze a mini support update.  Hopefully we can get some red posts to let us know if Riot has any plans or directions for support changes.

Mains:
Mostly tanky supports - {{champion:201}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:223}} 
I also play {{champion:117}} for fun and am saving up for {{champion:432}} after spamming him on free week.

Why I Like Support:
- Don't have to worry about CS 
- I feel that my role is thinking more about overall lane strategy and control as well as focusing on big picture strategy (especially when I play with friends).
- Warding (can't trust non-supports)
- I like CC and getting picks
- I pretty much love every support ultimate and they can be impactful

Problems:
- I feel like {{item:2049}}  is totally outshined by the yellow trinket.  Three wards is great but yellow trinket actually regenerates.
- Sightstone upgrades require forgoing the actives for FoM and FQC which is too costly.
- Consistently punished by being a lower level for doing my job (warding, roaming, etc.)
- Never reach late game fantasy/tankiness
- Even when you're ahead, you're never ahead

Suggestions:
- Let sightstone regenerate wards or feel on par to yellow trinket other than by just having three wards
- Sightstone upgrades indpendent of gp5 items
- Support-targeted keystones and masteries that correct for XP problems
- Possible stacking items like {{item:3027}} that don't make sense for non-supports to allow us to reach late-game fantasies (maybe low stats that would be inefficient on normal laners that can scale into solid secondary-tank and mage stats).

Riot said somewhere that supports should have the lowest downtime of any role, so I think they have a direction, curious if this means giving more mp5 and hp5 items.

replies.body: We play support because riot was to lazy to make a 4th lane and just decided to drop the support with the helpless dependent selfish adc.

Actually. The ADC/sup bot lane was an evolution of the European meta back in the early days of LoL. And contrary to popular belief, Riot has done very little to enforce this particular configuration. It's simply the most effective distribution of resources.

Hell, I remember when the popular meta was mage top, ADC mid, Tank/sup Bot.
The days of Cait/Vayne mid are long past. That was so much fun, though.
That is still not a bad idea because adc's benefit from the faster gold income at mid.
Too bad it doesn't work because after level 3 your name becomes "Zed's 300G minions"

ADC is such a valuable target to shutdown, and mid is one of the most gankable lanes.

A tank thats behind in levels from duo lane would get blown up in this META more easily.

Holding the ADCs hand with a support protects this powerful objective taking champ and helps to ensure some late game sustained damage.

METAs evolve because theyre better than old METAs in that the **M**ost **E**ffective **T**actic **A**vailable beats others, and you must adapt or die.

So as things are, trying that configuration my go south on you very quickly, and would of course require a team (probably a premade) to agree to it.
Everything makes sense but top mage xD. I would rather have an adc up here

Sort of.  Most Mages come with more CC than an ADC, unless it's an ADC Ult.

So being able to poke and CC can be really good up top.

Much like Quinn has a huge advantage over Melee Tops, so to do Mages.  The issue is, they (generally) have less mobility, so are more suspect to Ganks (not much of a problem for Quinn, who has both mobility and an Ability that hits then puts her at Max Attack Range from some one trying to engage).

So while not as effective as Quinn, a Mage Top can certainly work IF they ensure to not Over-Extend, use Wave Clear just outside of Turret and stall the wave until/unless the Top roams, then push and back or push and follow.

Certainly not Meta, and likely wrecked against a Gap Closer or Ranged (just like they generally would be in Mid)... but at least Ganks are only coming from one general direction.
Honestly, I enjoy being able to decide who lives and dies.

Used to be a {{champion:16}}  main before her rework, now I'm kinda bouncing between most of the main ones.

I prefer support because in laning phase I can ignore CSing to focus on manipulating the battlefield itself. I get to play the tactical game while the ADC has to concentrate on playing whack-a-mole. Mid-late game it's all about screwing with the enemy via CC and enabling allies to go above and beyond what they normally can do, sometimes literally saving them from death.

I think the biggest problem right now is that there is no real system in place to account for the fact that supports are deprived of both gold AND XP, and mid-game we are often gold-starved and underleveled, leading to us having to play like chickens and try to get in on every kill just to win enough assist gold to stay relevant.

I'd like to see Sightstone variants that built out of {{item:1052}}  and {{item:1027}} for more warding options besides health, which not every support benefits fully from.
i still main soraka i will never stop!personally i just wish supports didnt constantly get nerfed for going to solo lanes what ever happened to "diversity"

TBH I get why Soraka was hated in midlane; Q that required no brains, a W that enabled her to shrug off anything short of balls-to-the-wall all-in 2v1 gank, a targeted silence that dealt impressive damage, and the ability to farm assists with her global R without leaving lane, meaning that she didn't have to get any kills or roam to gain a gold advantage on you, she just had to freeze lane and not die.

What I don't get is why the drastic changes. They could have just as easily made W unable to be self-cast and added whatever weird wonky self-heal effect to Q (new Q would also have worked). As it is, currently Soraka is still toxic to face in low ELO mid-lane now that her self-heal levels with her poke instead of her ally heal, only now she's a giant pain to play as support.

I tend to play whatever fits the team composition, since I can play all supports.

Why I like support:
- I can control the feed bot lane. A bad support causes this lane (and often, the game) to fail most of the time. 
- I can control ward coverage.
- I can watch the map and warn/assist teammates.
- I provide the engage/counter-engage for fights.
- Free money for harassing!

Problems:
- Sightstone and wards were nerfed too hard. Cannot control vision enough, especially from behind. Everything gets sweeped away.
- {{item:3222}} This item is practically unusable because of the cooldown.
- Not as much impact in League of Burst Champions
...That's all I can think of. 

Suggestions:
- Un-nerf sightstone. Seriously. And/or make the ruby upgrade less expensive. Or simply automatically upgrade after a certain time.
- Let us place more than one pink ward, or give it its own slot.
- Let us buy green wards again.

I am a fill main and get mostly support and here's what I think are issues:


- No rewards, I can put kills on a plate for my ADC all day or save team mates from certain death, sometimes sacrificing myself. But it's the ones with the kills who get the credit. However, don't sacrifice yourself once or arrive too late to the fight and you'll be flamed.

- No waveclear, EVERY support game I get, my team are trying to play Team Deathmatch and leaving turrets to die. I spend most of post-laning phase clearing huge waves, if I don't, the turret will die and the CS will go to waste because my team just ignores them, no matter how much I ping or ask.

- XP & Gold. We get next to nothing compared to everyone else.
I think that in general lack of wave clear should be part of the class. But I think an anti-siege support with good wave clear would be a cool addition.

I play support because I don't have to focus on csing and I can approach the game more tactically. I play a lot of hard engage and disengage champions (Thresh, Alistar, Braum, and the occasional Bard) and I like picking my fights carefully and really controlling the battlefield, whether it's preemptively warding up an area of the jg you want to have a team fight in soon or rotating to other lanes and secure their leads. A good support should feel like the army general overseeing the rest of his or her platoon.

Leveling
I do undeniably have issues with this meta however. When 16 minutes into the game I'm 2 levels behind the rest of my team regardless of my personal performance, and thus substantially weaker than say their midlander who was 0-3 by 13 minutes. There's a problem.

Itemization
Although the sightstone changes were meant to be an improvement on the item, they were undeniably a flop, it's just really not ever worth it to take it over FOtM or FQC. I am a big supporter of the proposed changes to sightstone allowing them to regenerate. The trinket changes were a step in the right direction, however there are still issues like why is it that come late game I have to choose between going to full build like the rest of my team or flat out not buying my last item to keep a spot for a pink ward in my inventory. If there was a pink ward trinket or something this would be great or maybe if you could make an out of inventory holding similar to potions where you had an extra slot just for them. (I know these aren't the best ideas but it's getting the conversation started).

Let me share the other perspective on supports so this thread has a more balance discussion.  At Dia 5, I've had supports that randomly "afk" at our 1st tier turret during laning phase for  some random reason and this has costed us lane pressure sometimes when we had the advantage or if we were even, this gives the enemy a lead because as the marksman,  I have give up cs because the enemy bot notices this and will zone me.  One person told me they did this because they were watching another lane which confused me.
     Aside from that, there are multiple occasions where my support expends mana/spell cooldowns when its unnecessary to do so (ex: healing me when i'm 80% hp and have lifesteal). 
      A 3rd common issue I see is sometimes, supports roam too much or don't roam at all when they should.  There are optimal times to roam (ex: when ur adc is  recalled/enemy support is roaming/you know ur adc can handle 1v2). If you roam too much, not only are you vulnerable to a big level deficit but you are sacrificing  lane pressure at bot lane to help another lane. If you do not gain any advantages from the roam, you essentially screw over your bot lane. 

Bottom line is while I know this isn't every support, don't underplay the role. Support is extremely important to an ADC's success in the laning phase.
hit the nail on the head with the benefits of support, I think. There are advantages.

I play support because I'm too lazy to fight for roles, and that someone's gotta do it.

Can't trust anyone else doing the warding, or even peeling the *right* targets. People often listen to junglers and supports for shotcalling even if you're a backliner. Games become quiet because many support players actually are pretty whiny, and being the support yourself prevents that.

And of course, you can literally fuck up things singlehandedly and still don't get blamed. If anything, people always blame my ADC even if it's my fault, and that as a support mistakes are often easy to wipe away and make up. DC'd because #technicaldifficulties? You're not behind at all, because you don't even farm. Garbage mechanics? That's not even a requirement.

But of course as a trade off, I need at least a friend or two to actually make my efforts matter, and I'm fine with that.

Granted most teams realize the enemy is heavy ad their teammates build a lot of armor but would feel better if I had an item or items that provide some armor for my team and helped me as well.

Ex Support main (will come back when some major flaws are fixed):

**Champion pool:**
{{champion:12}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:412}} (why am I even listing this, I can play every Support to a decent level but enjoy tank supports the most)

**Why I like(d) being a Support:**
Creating pressure around mid and bot during laning Phase, enabling my ADC to get to a decent power fairly easily and then peeling for the carries. Also shotcalling.

**Problems:**
Supports being in a weak state right now. If you are not named Braum or Alistar your tankiness is fairly limited to assist Gold or extremely long games. If you are not named Soraka or Annie you won't do a lot as squishy Support (and Annie only every 5 minutes).

Season 6 eliminated macro play in ranked and thus made shotcalling pointless. Who will win, the team with 3 dragons and 4 towers or the team that is 15 kills up and has 3 towers? Most likely the team with kills due to gold advantage. (Solution to that is giving each dragon 100 Gold/Player)

Sightstone ward reduction. I usually go with the support item sightstones unless I really want that Face of the Mountain active to safe my carries/teammates from death. Then paying another 1k Gold for 1 more ward in your Stone? Not worth. Even if you get 20% CDR on your active items.

Hey, Gold 3 support main here (although I dabble in jg, it's basically the same thing except you're always roaming). 

Things I like:
-Warding
-The ability to have huge map impact really early
-People listen to me when I make calls
-Can feel very impactful in certain lane/teamfight situations

Things I don't like:
-Essentially no scaling towards any sort of late game, except stacking more mediocre actives
-Sightstone somehow feels worse than s5, and ruby sightstone is really really useless except for slightly boosting those mediocre actives
-Experience gains are so so so bad atm
-Mage supports feel really bad if you fall even slightly behind (looking at you Karma)

Essentially, I love the role, but it feels kinda bad at the moment. With experience as bad as it is, I just get two shotted on everything not named Alistar xD

I play support because when I first started, I was a ADC main and I got frustrated that no one seemed to be a good support. So I decided to give it a shot and found my calling. My mains are {{champion:267}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:44}}  with my back ups are {{champion:201}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:16}} . Been playing the role for a long time, I like doing more with less, and with how dangerous  it is to ward sometimes I feel like I'm a real scout (like the way {{champion:17}} should be). 

Problems: the nerfs to {{item:2049}} hurt. Bad. 3 charges aren't enough and with no green wards, it never feels like there's enough vision. Having to rely on your teammates to win fights. I can never win a 1v1 against anyone unless I'm insanely fed or they're just that bad. I never get the satisfaction of carrying a game. I'm not saying you can't as a support, but it doesn't feel as good as it is with other roles. Hell, half the time your own teammates won't even notice they're getting carried by you. They would think they did it themselves you allowed yourself to get carried. On a similar point, it feels even worse being on a losing team because you have to rely on your teammates that have already lost lane.

Suggestions: Like OP has suggested, allow {{item:2049}} {{item:2045}} to regenerate charges. I feel like there should be at least one support that should be the 'come back kid' and get better the further behind his own team is. I don't know how to fix the 'feel' of carrying a game. I wish I did.

Problems:

- Snowball

Mains: {{champion:37}} 

Why I like to play support:  Because {{champion:37}}  exists. 

Problems: {{champion:37}}'s entire patch note history.

Satire aside, I love Support because it's a different game for me. When I ADC I'm focusing on cs and outputting damage in teamfights. Playing midlane is basically the same, cs and do damage. But when I support I feel like I get to do more. I'm a constant threat to the opposing adc. "Just how obnoxious can I be this game?" I find myself wondering as we begin laning phase. After laning phase I get to act as a watchdog and fend off the opposing assassins as they click skillfully on my adc in an attempt to kill them, and if I play my cards right I can turn that around. Depending on what champ I'm playing depends on the kind of support I'm gonna offer. Sona being my favorite I tend to scare people away by accidentally ks-ing with a powercord. If I'm Morganna I give them time to take a break by hitting a Q, and if I'm Janna I can just blow everyone in the room to end the fight. 

That's my take on support. It's a completely different game.
